title: Submicron- and nanoplastic detection at low micro- to nanogram concentrations using gold nanostar-based surface-enhanced Raman scattering (SERS) substrates
content:
Environ. Sci.: Nano, 2024, 11,1000-1011
DOI: 10.1039/D3EN00401E, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Jessica Caldwell, Patricia Taladriz-Blanco, Laura Rodriguez-Lorenzo, Barbara Rothen-Rutishauser, Alke Petri-Fink
This study focuses on using gold nanostar-based SERS substrates to detect 4 different types of plastic (6 particle sizes within the submicron- and nano-regimes). Substrates could be used to detect concentrations of plastics as low as 625 ng mL−1.
